	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	one (1) supervisory director will be appointed by the Class C Meeting upon the binding nomination by Sofinnova Venture Partners IX, L.P.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage278"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	23.2
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The body of the Company authorised to appoint is allowed to appoint a supervisory director if the for that purpose authorized authority has not made a nomination within three months after the vacancy has arisen.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	23.3
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	A nomination shall be binding if it is made in time. The nomination can be deprived of its binding nature, however, by the body of the Company authorised to appoint by means of a resolution passed with a two-thirds
	(2/3) majority of the votes cast at that meeting, these votes representing more than half of the issued capital.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Article 24. Suspension
	and dismissal
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A supervisory director may at any time be suspended and dismissed by the authority authorised to appoint upon recommendation of the
	authority upon whose nomination he was appointed.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Article 25. Remuneration
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The general meeting may grant a remuneration to the supervisory directors.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Article 26. Duties and powers
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	26.1
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The duty of the board of supervisory directors shall be to supervise the policies of the board of managing directors and the general course of affairs of the Company and its affiliated business.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:6%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	It shall give advice to the board of managing directors. When performing their duties, the supervisory directors shall be guided by the
	interests of the Company and its affiliated business.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	26.2
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The board of supervisory directors may make a division of duties, specifying the individual duties of every supervisory director.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	26.3
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The board of managing directors shall timely provide each supervisory director with any such information as may be necessary for the board of supervisory directors to&nbsp;perform its duties. At least once a year the
	board of managing directors shall inform the board of supervisory directors in writing of the main lines of the&nbsp;Company&#146;s strategic policy, the general and financial risks and the management&nbsp;and control system.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	26.4
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Each supervisory director shall have access to the buildings and grounds of the Company and be authorized to inspect the books, records and other carriers of data&nbsp;of the Company.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:6%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The board of supervisory directors may appoint one or more persons from their&nbsp;midst or any expert to exercise such powers. The board of
	supervisory directors&nbsp;may also seek assistance of experts in other cases.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Article 27. Decision-making
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	27.1
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The chairman of the board of supervisory directors shall act as chairman of the meetings of the board of supervisory directors. The board of supervisory directors may from its midst appoint a secretary and make
	provisions for a substitute secretary.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	27.2
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	If the chairman is not present during a meeting, a chairman for that meeting shall be appointed from amongst those present.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	27.3
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The board of supervisory directors shall meet at least five times per year and at least once per calendar quarter, unless otherwise agreed by a vote of the majority of supervisory directors.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage279"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	27.4
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The secretary shall draw up the minutes of the meeting of board of supervisory directors. The minutes shall be confirmed during or at the next meeting and shall be signed by the chairman and the secretary.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	27.5
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	In the meeting of the board of supervisory directors each supervisory director has a right to cast one vote. Unless stated otherwise in these articles, all resolutions by the board of supervisory directors shall be
	adopted by an absolute majority of the votes cast. In the event the votes are equally divided, none of the supervisory directors has a decisive vote. In such case, each supervisory director shall be authorized to refer the matter for decision to the
	general meeting. The relevant proposal shall be deemed adopted in case the general meeting adopts a resolution to that effect.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	27.6
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	A supervisory director may grant another supervisory director a written proxy to represent him at the meeting. A supervisory director cannot represent more than one other supervisory director.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	27.7
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The board of supervisory directors may pass resolutions outside a meeting, provided that the resolution is adopted in writing and all supervisory directors have expressed themselves in favor of the proposal. The
	secretary shall make a report of the adopted resolution with an attachment of the responses of the supervisory directors with regard to the resolution passed. The report shall be signed by the chairman and the secretary.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	27.8
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The board of supervisory directors may adopt rules and regulations governing its decision-making process.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	27.9
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The board of supervisory directors shall have a meeting with the board of managing directors as often as a supervisory director or the board of managing directors deems necessary.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Article 27A. Absent or unable to act
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In the event that
	one or more supervisory directors shall be absent or be unable to act, the other remaining supervisory directors, or the only other remaining director shall be temporarily entrusted with the supervision.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In the event that all supervisory directors shall be absent or be unable to act, the supervision shall be temporarily entrusted to the person designated or to
	be designated for that purpose by the general meeting.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	CHAPTER IX
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Annual accounts. Profits
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Article 28. Financial year.
	Drawing up the annual accounts
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	28.1
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The Company&#146;s financial year shall correspond with the calendar year.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	28.2
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Within three months of the end of the Company&#146;s financial year, the board of managing directors shall draw up the annual accounts unless, in special circumstances, an extension of this term by not more than six
	months is approved by the general meeting.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	28.3
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The annual accounts shall be signed by all the managing directors and supervisory directors; if the signature of any of them is missing, this fact and the reason for such omission shall be stated.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	28.4
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The board of supervisory directors may submit to the general meeting a preliminary advice on the annual accounts.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage280"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Article 29. Auditor
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	29.1
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The Company shall commission an auditor to examine the annual accounts.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	29.2
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The general meeting shall be authorized to grant such commission. If the general meeting fails to do so, the board of supervisory directors is authorized, or if the board of supervisory directors fails to do so, the
	board of managing directors. The commission may at any time be withdrawn by the general meeting and the one who granted the commission; the commission granted by the board of managing directors may also be withdrawn by the board of supervisory
	directors.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	29.3
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The auditor shall report his findings to the board of supervisory directors and the board of managing directors.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	29.4
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The auditor shall record his findings in a report commenting on the true and fair nature of the annual accounts.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	29.5
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The previous provision and the one set out in article 30.3, second sentence, shall not apply if the Company has obtained an exemption under article 2:396 paragraph 6 of the Netherlands Civil Code on the grounds of the
	size of its business, or under article 2:403 of the Netherlands Civil Code on the basis that the Company is a member of a group.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Article
	30. Presentation to the shareholders and depositary receipt holders. Availability. Adoption
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	30.1
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The annual accounts shall be deposited at the Company&#146;s office for inspection by the shareholders and depositary receipt holders within the period of time specified in article 28.2. The board of managing directors
	shall also submit the annual report within the same term.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	30.2
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The Company shall ensure that the annual accounts, the annual report, the preliminary advice of the board of supervisory directors, if any, and the additional data to be added pursuant to article 2:392 paragraph 1 of
	the Netherlands Civil Code shall be available at its office from the day notice is sent out for the general meeting at which these documents will be handled. Shareholders and depositary receipt holders may inspect these documents at the
	Company&#146;s office and may obtain a complimentary copy thereof.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	30.3
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The general meeting shall adopt the annual accounts. The annual accounts cannot be adopted if the general meeting has not been able to examine the auditor&#146;s report referred to in article 29.4, unless under the
	additional data as mentioned in paragraph&nbsp;2, a lawful ground has been stated for the absence of the auditor&#146;s report.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	30.4
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The provisions set out in these articles of association regarding the annual report and the additional data to be added under article&nbsp;2:392 paragraph 1 of the Netherlands Civil Code shall not apply if the Company
	is a member of a group and article&nbsp;2:396 paragraph 6, first sentence, or article 2:403 of the Netherlands Civil Code applies to the Company.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage281"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Article 31. Publication
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	31.1
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The Company shall be required to publish its annual accounts within eight days of their adoption. Publication shall be accomplished by depositing the Netherlands text of the accounts, or if no Netherlands text has been
	drawn up, a French, German or an English version, at the Trade Register in the town where the Company is registered. The date of adoption must be indicated on the accounts so deposited.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	31.2
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	If the annual accounts are not adopted within two months after the end of the requisite term in conformity with the statutory requirements, the board of managing directors shall immediately publish the annual accounts
	in the manner prescribed in paragraph 1; the annual accounts must state that they have not yet been adopted.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	31.3
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	A copy of the annual report and the additional data required to be added under article 2:392 of the Netherlands Civil Code shall also be published, along with and in the same manner and language as the annual accounts.
	This shall, except for the information referred to in article 2:392 paragraph 1 under a, c, f and g of the Netherlands Civil Code, not apply if the documents are deposited at the Company&#146;s registered office for public inspection and full or
	partial copies shall be supplied upon request at cost; the Company shall file this fact with the Trade Register.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	31.4
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	If, on the basis of the size of the Company&#146;s business, the exemption under article 2:396 paragraph 3 up to and including 8 or article 2:397 paragraph 3 up to and including 6 of the Netherlands Civil Code applies
	to the Company, publication shall take place with due observance of the exemptions applicable. The previous provisions of this article shall not apply if the Company is a member of a group and the exemption under article 2:403 of the Netherlands
	Civil Code applies to the Company.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Article 32. Profits
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	32.1
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The Company shall maintain a profit reserve for the benefit of the common shareholders (profit reserve Common) a profit reserve for the benefit of the A shareholders (profit reserve A), a profit reserve for the benefit
	of the B shareholders (profit reserve B) and a profit reserve for the benefit of the C shareholders (profit reserve C).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	32.2
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Of the profits generated during the past financial year, first, if possible, a sum equal to eight percent (8%) of the sum paid up on the Class C shares (nominal share capital and share premium) will be allocated to the
	profit reserve C with the understanding that, should the shares concerned not have been issued during the entire year over which the allocation is calculated, the allocation will be calculated over the period of the year during which the shares were
	issued. The Company shall in relation to each shareholder keep in its administration an up-to-date list as to which shares were issued at which moment and which amount has been paid up on the shares, in order to be able to determine to which extent
	the shareholder is entitled to profit reserve C. If the profits do not permit a profit allocation as contemplated in this paragraph, the missing portion shall be added to the profit reserve C out of the profits of the next financial year(s), before
	any further allocations shall be made.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage282"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	32.3
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Subsequently, after the application of article 32.2, out of the profits remaining if possible, a sum equal to eight percent (8%) of the sum paid up on the Class B shares (nominal share capital and share premium) will be
	allocated to the profit reserve B with the understanding that, should the shares concerned not have been issued during the entire year over which the allocation is calculated, the allocation will be calculated over the period of the year during
	which the shares were issued. The Company shall in relation to each shareholder keep in its administration an up- to-date list as to which shares were issued at which moment and which amount has been paid up on the shares, in order to be able to
	determine to which extent the shareholder is entitled to profit reserve B. If the profits do not permit a profit allocation as contemplated in this paragraph, the missing portion shall be added to the profit reserve B out of the profits of the next
	financial year(s), before any further allocations shall be made.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	32.4
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Subsequently, after the application of article 32.3 the profits remaining will be added to the profit reserve Common, the profit reserve A, the profit reserve B and the profit reserve C, pro rata to the number of Common
	shares issuable upon conversion of such Preferred share at such time.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	32.5
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The Company can only make distributions to the extent its equity exceeds the reserves, which must be maintained pursuant to the law or these articles of association. The resolution to declare a distribution does not
	have any effect without the prior approval of the board of directors. The board of directors shall only refuse its approval, if it knows or should reasonably foresee that the Company, following the distribution, can no longer continue to meet its
	due and payable debts.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	32.6
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	With due observance of the provisions of paragraph 5, the general meeting may resolve to make distributions out of the profit reserves, only with the prior approval by the Preferred Meeting with the Preferred Majority.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	32.7
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Dividends shall be paid after the adoption of the annual accounts evidencing that the payment of dividends is lawful.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	32.8
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The general meeting may, with due observance of the provisions of paragraphs 5 and 6, resolve to pay, wholly or partly, dividends other than in cash, with the understanding that such a resolution requires at all times
	the prior approval by the Preferred Majority.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	32.9
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	For the calculation of the amount to be distributed on the shares, the shares held by the Company in its own capital shall not be taken into account.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	32.10
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Notwithstanding anything to the contrary herein, any of the foregoing dividends shall be payable (i) in cash, if and when declared by the supervisory board, subject to prior approval of the Preferred Meeting with the
	Preferred Majority, (ii) in kind upon any Liquidation Event, or (iii) in kind upon the occurrence of a conversion of Preferred shares into Common shares (except in connection with a conversion in which each five Preferred shares are converted into
	one Common share).
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage283"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	CHAPTER X
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	General meetings. Meetings of holders of shares of the same class
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Article 33. Annual general meeting
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	33.1
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Within six months of the end of the Company&#146;s financial year the annual general meeting shall be held.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	33.2
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The agenda of that meeting shall, among other matters, contain the following items:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	a.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the annual report;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	b.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	adoption of the annual accounts;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	c.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	discharge of the managing directors for their management over the past financial year;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	d.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	discharge of the supervisory directors for their supervision of the past financial year over the management of the board of managing directors;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	e.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	adoption of the profit appropriation;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	f.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	filling of any vacancies;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	g.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	any such other motions as the board of supervisory directors, the board of managing directors, or the shareholders or any other persons having voting rights together representing not less than one-tenth of the issued
	capital, may file and notify with due observance of the provisions of article 35.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Article 34. Extraordinary general meetings
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Without prejudice of the provisions of article 33.1, general meetings shall be held as often as a managing director, the board of managing directors and/or the
	board of supervisory directors deem necessary, or shareholders and depositary receipt holders together representing at least one-tenth of the issued capital (the &#147;requesting shareholders&#148;).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Article 35. Convocation. Agenda
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	35.1
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	General meetings shall be called by a managing director, the board of managing directors, the board of supervisory directors, or by the requesting shareholders. The requesting shareholders are only authorized to call
	the general meeting themselves if it is evidenced that the requesting shareholders have requested the board of managing directors to call a general meeting in writing, exactly stating the matters to be discussed, and the board of managing directors,
	or a managing director have not taken the necessary steps so that the general meeting could be held within six weeks after the request. If the requesting shareholders represent more than half of the issued capital, however, they shall be authorized
	to call the general meeting themselves without first having to request the board of managing directors to call the general meeting. The requirement of a written request is also met if the request is recorded electronically.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	35.2
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Convocation shall take place not later than on the fifteenth day prior to the day of the meeting.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	35.3
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The convening notice shall specify the items to be discussed. Items which have not been specified in the convening notice may be announced with due observance of the requirements of this article.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:6%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	An item of which the discussion has been requested by one or more holders of shares who individually or together represent at least one
	hundredth part of the issued capital shall be included in the convocation or shall be announced in the
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage284"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:6%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	same manner provided that the Company receives the request no later than on the thirtieth day before the meeting and provided that such a request does not conflict with a substantial interest of
	the Company.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	35.4
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	All convocations for general meetings and all notifications to shareholders and depositary receipt holders shall be given by letters to the addresses according to the register of shareholders and the register of
	depository receipt holders. In case the shareholder, or the holder of a depositary receipt issued with the Company&#146;s cooperation, consents herewith, the convocation may also occur through an electronically transmitted readable and reproducible
	message at the address that has been provided by him to the Company for this purpose.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Article 36. Place of the meetings
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	General meetings shall be held in the municipality in the Netherlands in which the Company has its corporate seat, or in Amsterdam, Schiphol Airport
	(municipality of Haarlemmermeer), Rotterdam or The Hague. In a meeting held elsewhere, valid resolutions can only be taken if the entire issued capital is represented.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Article 37. Imperfect convocation general meeting
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	37.1
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Valid resolutions in respect of matters which were not mentioned on the agenda in the convocation letter or which have not been published in the same manner and with due observance of the period set for convocation, can
	only be taken by unanimous votes in a meeting where the entire issued capital is represented.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	37.2
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	If the period for convocation mentioned in article 35.2 was shorter or if no convocation has taken place, valid resolutions can only be taken by unanimous votes in a meeting where the entire issued capital is
	represented.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Article 38. Chairman
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	38.1
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The general meetings shall be chaired by the chairman of the board of supervisory directors.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	38.2
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	If the chairman of the board of supervisory directors is not present, the meeting shall appoint its chairman itself.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Article 39. Minutes
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	39.1
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Minutes shall be taken of the matters discussed at every general meeting by a secretary to be appointed by the chairman. The minutes shall be adopted by the chairman and the secretary and signed by them to that effect.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	39.2
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The chairman, or the person who requested the meeting, may decide that an official notarial report should be drawn up of the matters discussed at the meeting.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:6%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This report must be co-signed by the chairman.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Article 40. Rights exercisable during a meeting. Admission
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	40.1
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Every person entitled to vote and every usufructuary and pledgee having voting rights shall be authorized to attend the general meeting, address the meeting and exercise their voting rights.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	40.2
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	If the voting rights attached to a share is vested in the usufructuary or pledgee instead of the shareholder, also the shareholder shall be authorized to attend the general meeting and to address the meeting.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	40.3
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Furthermore, depositary receipt holders shall be authorized to attend and address the general meeting.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage285"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	40.4
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Each Common share shall entitle its holder to cast one vote. Each Preferred share shall entitle the holder to cast a number of votes equal to the number of Common shares issuable upon conversion of such Preferred share
	at the time of such vote.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	40.5
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Every person entitled to vote or his representative must sign the attendance list.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	40.6
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The rights referred to in the previous paragraphs may be exercised by a person acting upon a written power of attorney. A power of attorney shall mean any power of attorney transmitted via standard means of
	communication and received in written form. The requirement of a written power of attorney is also met in case the power of attorney has been recorded electronically.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	40.7
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The supervisory directors and the managing directors shall have an advisory vote at the general meeting.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	40.8
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Admission to the general meeting of persons other than those referred to in this article shall require a resolution by the general meeting.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	40.9
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The board of managing directors is authorized to determine that participation in the general meeting may also occur through an electronic communication method, under the conditions as may be announced in the
	convocation. Through the electronic communication method, the relevant participants must be able to be identified, directly take note of the discussions at the meeting and to exercise the voting rights.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Article 41. Decision making. General meeting
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	41.1
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Resolutions shall be passed by an absolute majority, unless the law, the articles of association or regulations adopted by the general meeting prescribe a greater majority of the votes cast.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	41.2
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	If no absolute majority is reached by a vote taken with respect to the election of persons, a second vote shall be taken whereby the voters are not required to vote for the previous candidates.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:6%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If, again, no one has gained an absolute majority of the votes, new votes shall be held until either one person has gained an absolute majority
	or, if the vote was between two persons, the votes are equally divided.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:6%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Such new votes (except for the second vote) shall only take place
	between the candidates who were voted for in the previous vote, except for the person who received the least number of votes.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:6%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If two or
	more persons have the least number of votes, it shall be decided by lot who cannot be voted for at the new vote.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:6%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If, in the event of an
	election between two candidates, the votes are equally divided, it shall be decided by lot who has been elected.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	41.3
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	If a vote is taken in respect of matters other than in relation to election of persons and the votes are equally divided, the relevant motion shall be considered rejected.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	41.4
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	All votings shall take place orally unless the chairman decides or any person entitled to vote requests a voting in writing. A voting in writing shall take place by means of unsigned ballot papers.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	41.5
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Abstentions and invalid votes shall be deemed not to have been cast.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage286"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	41.6
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Votes by acclamation shall be allowed unless one of the persons present and entitled to vote objects.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	41.7
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The chairman&#146;s view at the meeting expressing that the general meeting has passed a resolution shall be decisive. The same shall apply to the contents of the&nbsp;resolution so passed, provided that the relevant
	motion was not put down in writing.&nbsp;However, if the chairman&#146;s view is challenged immediately after it is expressed, a&nbsp;new vote shall be taken when the majority of the persons present and entitled to&nbsp;vote so require or, if the
	original vote was not by call or by ballot, when one person&nbsp;present and entitled to vote so requires. The new vote shall nullify the legal&nbsp;consequences of the original vote.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Article 42. Resolutions passed outside a meeting
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Resolutions of the shareholders may be adopted in a different method than in a meeting, provided that all persons with meeting right have approved in writing
	of such method of adopting resolutions.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If a resolution is adopted outside a meeting, all votes shall be cast in writing. This requirement (that votes
	must be cast in writing) shall also be deemed to have been complied with, if the resolution is laid down in writing and includes the method in which each of the shareholders has cast his vote. The directors shall be given the opportunity to advise
	in advance on the resolution(s) to be adopted.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Article 43. Meetings of holders of shares of the same class or a number of classes
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	43.1
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Meetings of holders of shares of the same class or a combined meeting of holders of a number of (but not all) classes of shares are convened by the board of managing directors or by a holder of one or more shares of the
	class or one of the classes concerned.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	43.2
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Article 35, paragraphs 2 up to and including 4, and articles 36 up to and including 42, shall apply accordingly.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	CHAPTER XI
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Amendment to the articles of association,
	merger, demerger and dissolution. Liquidation
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Article 44. Amendment to the articles of association, merger, demerger and dissolution
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The general meeting may resolve to amend the articles of association, to merge, to demerge, or to dissolve the Company, with the understanding that such a
	resolution requires the prior approval by the Preferred Majority.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If a motion to amend the articles of association or to dissolve the Company is to be
	submitted to the general meeting, the convening notice must state this fact. At the same time, if the motion is for an amendment to the articles of association, a copy of the motion containing a verbatim text of the proposed amendment must be
	deposited at the Company&#146;s office for inspection by the shareholders and depositary receipt holders until the meeting has been held.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Article 45.
	Liquidation
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	45.1
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	If the Company is dissolved pursuant to a resolution by the general meeting, which resolution shall require the prior approval by the Preferred Majority, the managing directors shall be the liquidators of the dissolved
	Company, unless the general meeting appoints other persons to that effect. The board of supervisory directors shall supervise the liquidation.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage287"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	45.2
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The provisions of these articles of association shall, to the fullest extent possible, continue to be in force during the liquidation.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	45.3
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The proceeds remaining after the payment of all debts (the surplus) shall be at the disposal of the general meeting.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="6%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	45.4
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	After the Company has ceased to exist the books, records and other carriers of data shall be kept by the person designated thereto by the liquidators for seven years.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_EXHIBIT_3>

<DIV CLASS="eolNewPage"></DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage288"></A>
<A NAME="D29248DEX32_HTM"></A>
<EFX_EXHIBIT_3>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_3_2"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	Exhibit 3.2
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Deed of Conversion and Amendment of the Articles of Association
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
</B>
	of:
<B>
	Merus B.V (new name: Merus N.V.)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Draft deed
	dated 4&nbsp;May 2016
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Subject to changes
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This * day
	of * two thousand and sixteen appeared before me, Freerk Volders, civil law notary (
<I>
	notaris
</I>
	) in Rotterdam, the Netherlands (&#147;
<B>
	Notary
</B>
	&#148;):
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	*, according to [her]/[his] statement acting in order to implement a resolution to convert and amend the articles of association, adopted on the * day of *
	two thousand and sixteen in the general meeting of
<B>
	Merus B.V.
</B>
	, a private company with limited liability (
<I>
	besloten vennootschap met beperkte aansprakelijkheid
</I>
	) under Dutch law, having its official seat in Utrecht, the Netherlands and
	its place of business at 3584 CH Utrecht, Pardualaan 8, the Netherlands, registered with the Trade Register of the Chamber of Commerce under file number: 30189136 (&#147;
<B>
	Merus BV
</B>
	&#148;), during which meeting the person appearing was also
	authorized to implement the aforementioned resolution.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The articles of association have most recently been amended by a notarial deed of amendment of the
	articles of association executed before Freerk Volders, aforementioned, on the twenty-first day of August two thousand and fifteen.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The person appearing,
	acting as aforesaid, has stated that as a result of the aforementioned resolution to convert and amend the articles of association, Merus BV will be converted into a limited liability company (
<I>
	naamloze vennootschap
</I>
	) under Dutch law (the
	&#147;
<B>
	Company
</B>
	&#148;) and as from today the articles of association of Merus BV shall be read as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	ARTICLES OF ASSOCIATION
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Definitions
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In these articles of association the
	following words shall have the following meanings:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	a.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	CEO
</B>
	: the Company&#146;s chief executive officer;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	b.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	chairman of the supervisory board
</B>
	: the chairman of the supervisory board;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	c.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	class meeting
</B>
	: the meeting of holders of shares of a certain class;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	d.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	general meeting
</B>
	: the general meeting of shareholders as body of the Company as well as meetings of this body;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	e.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	group company
</B>
	: An entity or company which is organisationally connected with the Company in an economic unit within the meaning of Section 2:24b of the Dutch Civil Code;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	f.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	indemnified officer
</B>
	: a current or former managing director or supervisory director;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	g.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	management board/managing director(s)
</B>
	: the management board/the managing director(s) of the Company in the meaning of the Dutch Civil Code;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	h.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	management board rules
</B>
	: the internal rules applicable to the management board, as drawn up by the management board;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<A NAME="eolPage289"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	i.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	meeting right
</B>
	: the right to, in person or by written proxy, attend and address the general meeting;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	j.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	non-distributable equity
</B>
	: the part of the company&#146;s equity that is formed by the paid up and called up part of its capital and the reserves which it must maintain by law;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	k.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	person with meeting right
</B>
	: a shareholder, a usufructuary or pledgee with meeting rights;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	l.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	preferred distribution
</B>
	: a distribution on the preferred shares for an amount equal to the preferred interest rate calculated over the aggregate amount paid up on those preferred shares, whereby:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	a.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	any amount paid up on those preferred shares (including as a result of an issue of preferred shares) during the financial year (or the relevant part thereof) in respect of which the distribution is made shall only be
	taken into account proportionate to the number of days that elapsed during that financial year (or the relevant part thereof) after those preferred shares were paid up;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	b.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	any reduction of the aggregate amount paid-up on preferred shares during the financial year (or the relevant part thereof) in respect of which the distribution is made shall be taken into account proportionate to the
	number of days that elapsed during that financial year (or the relevant part thereof) until such reduction of the aggregate amount paid-up on preferred shares was effected; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	c.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	if the distribution is made in respect of part of a financial year, the amount of the distribution shall be proportionate to the number of days that elapsed during that part of the financial year;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	m.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	preferred interest rate
</B>
	: the mathematical average, calculated over the financial year (or the relevant part thereof) in respect of which a distribution is made on preferred shares, of the EURIBOR interest rate
	for loans with a maturity of twelve months as published by Thomson Reuters, plus a margin not exceeding five hundred basis points (500bps) to be determined by the management board each time when preferred shares are issued without preferred shares
	already forming part of the Company&#146;s issued share capital;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	n.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	registration date
</B>
	: the twenty-eighth day prior to the date of the general meeting;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	o.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	absolute majority
</B>
	: more than half of the votes cast;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	p.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	subsidiary
</B>
	: a subsidiary within the meaning of Section 2:24a of the Dutch Civil Code, including:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	a.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	an entity in whose general meeting the Company or one or more of its subsidiaries can exercise, whether or not by virtue of an agreement with other parties with voting rights, individually or collectively, more than
	half of the voting rights; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	b.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	an entity of which the Company or one or more of its subsidiaries are members or shareholders and can appoint or dismiss, whether or not by virtue of an agreement with other parties with voting rights, individually or
	collectively, more than half of the managing directors or of the supervisory directors, even if all parties with voting rights cast their votes;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	CHAPTER I: NAME, OFFICIAL SEAT AND OBJECTS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Name. Official seat
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Article 1
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	1.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The Company is a limited liability company (
<I>
	naamloze vennootschap
</I>
	) and its name is:
<B>
	Merus N.V.
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The Company has its official seat in Utrecht.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">

	Objects
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">

	Article 2
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">

	established are:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>

</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">

</TD>

</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	b.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	to finance enterprises and companies;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	c.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	to borrow, to lend to raise funds, including the issue of bonds, promissory notes or other securities or evidence of indebtedness as well as to enter into agreements in connection with the aforementioned;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	d.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	to supply advice and to render services to enterprises and companies with which the Company forms a group and to third parties;
</TD>
</TR>

<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	e.
</TD>

</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
